intro: Elephantopus senegalensis, commonly known as African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. It has a taproot system that allows it to survive in poor soil conditions. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
